data.title: The State Duma adopted a law introducing the "take or pay" principle for long-term gas supplies
data.meta_description: The State Duma adopted a law introducing the "take or pay" principle for long-term gas supplies The deputies approved amendments to the law "On Gas Supply in the Russian Federation" and Articles 5.2 and 52.1 of the Urban Planning Code of the Russian Federation. | AKM.RU
data.text:
AK&M 29 November 2023 18:11

The State Duma adopted in the third, final reading amendments to the law "On Gas Supply in the Russian Federation" and Articles 5.2 and 52.1 of the Urban Planning Code of the Russian Federation. This was reported by the press service of the lower house of parliament.

The law establishes a new category of gas buyers who have a preferential right to conclude supply contracts, namely Russian industrial consumers who want to conclude a long-term gas supply contract on a "take or pay" basis.

The categories will be determined by the Government of the Russian Federation, including new industrial facilities for oil and gas processing and petrochemistry, production of thermal and electric energy, in need of long-term supply of large volumes of gas.

The law introduces the concept of "gas supply and gasification scheme of the subject of the Russian Federation", and also establishes the principle of "take or pay" for long-term gas supplies.

The conceptual framework is being clarified, in particular the term "gas", the concept of "gas supply and gasification scheme of the subject of the Russian Federation" is being introduced, the powers of federal and regional gasification operators are being clarified.
